column2: 1) happening over a long period and involving a lot of difficulties 漫长而艰难的
column3: e.g. Three generations of fishermen are engaged in an [[epic]] struggle against nature, fate, and society in this moving tale.；e.g. This island is a place of great adventures and [[epic]] tales, inhabited by five tribes.

column2: 2) telling a long story about brave actions and exciting events 英雄的；英勇的；史诗般的
column3: e.g. Three generations of fishermen are engaged in an [[epic]] struggle against nature, fate, and society in this moving tale.；e.g. This island is a place of great adventures and [[epic]] tales, inhabited by five tribes.

column2: having a rough or pointed edge or surface 凹凸不平的；锯齿状的
column3: e.g. For centuries, the Rocky Mountains have captivated visitors with their [[jagged]] peaks, magnificent waterfalls, and blue lakes.

column2: [C, U] smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through 烟雾；霾
column3: e.g. Just as the Sun began to break through an early-morning [[haze]], I spotted three horses on a hill.

column2: give sth. a small amount of a particular color, emotion, or quality 着淡色于···；使带有一点（情绪、特质等）
column3: e.g. The light of the setting sun [[tinges]] the buildings with delicate colors.

column2: 1) [C] a particular type of red, green, blue, etc. （色彩的）浓淡，深浅，色度
column3: e.g. The bright yellow [[shade]] is meant to evoke the optimistic promise of a sunshine-filled day.；e.g. I spent most of the day walking on the shore or reading a novel in the [[shade]] of a large beach umbrella.

column2: 2) [U] slight darkness or shelter from the direct light of the Sun made by sth. blocking it 背阴处；阴凉处
column3: e.g. The bright yellow [[shade]] is meant to evoke the optimistic promise of a sunshine-filled day.；e.g. I spent most of the day walking on the shore or reading a novel in the [[shade]] of a large beach umbrella.

column2: (of a feeling, belief, etc.) lasting for a long time and not changing （感情或信念等）长久的，持久的
column3: e.g. My [[abiding]] memory is of him watering his plants in the garden on sunny afternoons.

column2: [C] sb. who knows a lot about a particular subject, esp. one that is not a science subject （尤指精于一门文科学问的）学者
column3: e.g. He is internationally recognized as a distinguished [[scholar]] in the field of Chinese studies.

column2: [C] sb. who takes complete control of a country or its people 征服者
column3: e.g. Local people have to obey their [[conquerors]] because they want to go on living.

column2: make a sudden sideways movement while moving forward, usu. in order to avoid hitting sth. （通常为了避免碰撞）突然转向一边
column3: e.g. The vehicle [[swerved]] off the road, hit a lamppost and rolled several times before catching fire.

column2: move forward or backward while also quickly moving slightly from side to side 一摇一摆地走（移动）
column3: e.g. The performer shook, jumped and [[shimmied]] in perfect motion, spurring the crowd to rise in an emotional applause.

column2: move slowly along on wheels, or make sth. do this by pushing or pulling it （使）缓慢移动（滚动）
column3: e.g. Hundreds of trucks full of fruit and vegetables [[trundled]] across the border each day.

column2: 1) （尤指穿越沙漠地带的）旅行队，商队
2) （AmE trailer）（带有食宿设备的）旅行拖车
[C, U] 香料
1) (written) knock sb. down with great force （用力）击倒（某人）
column3: e.g. A 25-year-old man was [[felled]] by that boxer with a single punch.；e.g. Fifteen million trees were [[felled]] by the Great Storm which hit the south of England in 1987.

column2: 2) cut down a tree 砍伐（树木）
column3: e.g. A 25-year-old man was [[felled]] by that boxer with a single punch.；e.g. Fifteen million trees were [[felled]] by the Great Storm which hit the south of England in 1987.

column2: 1) [C, usu. pl.] (lit. or fml.) a danger or problem in a particular activity or situation （某活动或情况的）危险，凶险
column3: e.g. These birds are able to survive the [[perils]] of the Arctic winter.；e.g. This was the second time that he had put his life in [[peril]] to rescue someone at risk of drowning.

column2: 2) [U] (lit. or fml.) great danger, esp. of being harmed or killed 巨大的危险（尤指受损或被杀）
column3: e.g. These birds are able to survive the [[perils]] of the Arctic winter.；e.g. This was the second time that he had put his life in [[peril]] to rescue someone at risk of drowning.

column2: relating to the weather in a particular area 气候的
column3: e.g. It should be noted that some parts of the world seem to be experiencing [[climatic]] changes.

column2: (fml.) move across, over, or through sth., esp. an area of land or water 跨过；穿过；横越；横穿
column3: e.g. They crossed the bridge and [[traversed]] the road out into the open country.

column2: 1) belonging to an enemy 敌人的；敌方的
column3: e.g. They warned us that the northern half of the island was controlled by [[hostile]] forces.；e.g. Rebecca was very [[hostile]] toward us and made it clear she didn't want our help.

column2: 2) angry and deliberately unfriendly toward sb. and ready to argue with them 怀有敌意的；敌对的；不好的
column3: e.g. They warned us that the northern half of the island was controlled by [[hostile]] forces.；e.g. Rebecca was very [[hostile]] toward us and made it clear she didn't want our help.

column2: [C, U] land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force 领土；版图；领地
column3: e.g. The new oil contracts will amount to a half billion dollars' worth of foreign investment in their [[territory]].

column2: continue to do sth., although this is difficult, or other people oppose it 坚持；执意
column3: e.g. He urged the United States to [[persist]] with its efforts to bring about peace.

column2: [sing.] the feeling of wanting or needing a drink 渴；口渴
column3: e.g. After walking five miles, they had worked up a great [[thirst]] and decided to stop for water.

column2: [C, U] a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave 思想（体系）；思想意识
column3: e.g. To put it another way, the analysis lacks both a sense of humanism and a theory of [[ideology]].

column2: [U, sing.] a mysterious, exciting, or desirable quality 诱惑；魅力；吸引力
column3: e.g. There will always be "lost in translation" moments, but that's part of the [[allure]] of foreign travel.

column2: being part of the nature or character of sb. / sth. 本质的；内在的；固有的
column3: e.g. The [[intrinsic]] value of a coin is the value of the metal it is made of.

column2: 1) [U] the feeling of excitement and adventure that is related to a particular place, activity, etc. 传奇色彩；浪漫情调
column3: e.g. There are plenty of ways to see the country this summer, but few can beat the [[romance]] of traveling on a steam train.；e.g. Hemingway's [[romance]] with his nurse inspired him to write A Farewell to Arms.

column2: 2) [C] an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other 罗曼史；风流韵事
column3: e.g. There are plenty of ways to see the country this summer, but few can beat the [[romance]] of traveling on a steam train.；e.g. Hemingway's [[romance]] with his nurse inspired him to write A Farewell to Arms.

column2: 1) believe that sth. sb. does or sth. that happens has a particular meaning 把···理解（解释）为
column3: e.g. His refusal to work late was [[interpreted]] as a lack of commitment to the company.；e.g. She couldn't speak much English so her children had to [[interpret]] for her while traveling in the UK.

column2: 2) translate spoken words from one language into another 口译
column3: e.g. His refusal to work late was [[interpreted]] as a lack of commitment to the company.；e.g. She couldn't speak much English so her children had to [[interpret]] for her while traveling in the UK.

column2: 1) continuing for a long time 持久的
column3: e.g. The feelings that arise in that condition are simpler, more understandable, and more [[durable]].；e.g. Fine bone china is very practical due to the fact that it is strong and [[durable]].

column2: 2) staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot 耐用的
column3: e.g. The feelings that arise in that condition are simpler, more understandable, and more [[durable]].；e.g. Fine bone china is very practical due to the fact that it is strong and [[durable]].

column2: [C] (fml.) (be a ~ to sth.) prove or show very clearly that sth. exists or is true 是···的证据；是···的证明
column3: e.g. The new model is a [[testament]] to the skill and dedication of the workforce.

column2: 1) make sb. feel strong admiration 使···倾倒
column3: e.g. As children, we were [[dazzled]] by my uncle's good looks and charm.；e.g. Drivers are supposed to slow down or pull over when they are [[dazzled]] by bright sunlight.

column2: 2) makes sb. unable to see properly for a short time （因强光、闪烁等）使···目眩；使···眼花缭乱
column3: e.g. As children, we were [[dazzled]] by my uncle's good looks and charm.；e.g. Drivers are supposed to slow down or pull over when they are [[dazzled]] by bright sunlight.

column2: 1) repeat exactly the same journey that sb. else has made 重走（别人走过的路程）
column3: e.g. They are hoping to [[retrace]] the [[epic]] voyage of Christopher Columbus.；e.g. By trailing a thread behind them spiders are able to drop from any height to the ground and to [[retrace]] their steps with certainty to a particular spot.

column2: 2) go back exactly the way you have come 顺原路返回；折返
column3: e.g. They are hoping to [[retrace]] the [[epic]] voyage of Christopher Columbus.；e.g. By trailing a thread behind them spiders are able to drop from any height to the ground and to [[retrace]] their steps with certainty to a particular spot.

column2: a.relating or referring to Buddhism 佛教的
column3: e.g. Lingyin Temple is a famous [[Buddhist]] temple situated in the northwest of Hangzhou.

column2: n.[C] sb. who believes in Buddhism 佛教徒
column3: e.g. Lingyin Temple is a famous [[Buddhist]] temple situated in the northwest of Hangzhou.

column2: [C] (pl. grottos or grottoes) a small attractive cave 小洞穴
column3: e.g. This [[grotto]] houses the most exquisite stone sculptures from the Tang Dynasty.

column2: 1) move or go somewhere slowly 缓缓移动；缓慢行走
column3: e.g. The crowd [[drifted]] away from the scene of the accident.；e.g. As our boat [[drifted]] down the river, many children ran along the shore waving at us.

column2: 2) move slowly on water or in the air 漂流；漂移
column3: e.g. The crowd [[drifted]] away from the scene of the accident.；e.g. As our boat [[drifted]] down the river, many children ran along the shore waving at us.

column2: surrounded by beautiful views of nature 景色优美的
column3: e.g. Yosemite National Park is an area of outstanding [[scenic]] beauty and great wilderness value.

column2: 1) [C, U] rock or cloud that is formed in a particular shape, or the shape in which it is formed （岩石或云朵的）形成物；形状
column3: e.g. Enormous cloud [[formations]] dominate the landscape on a hot, humid summer's day.；e.g. An agreement on the [[formation]] of a new government was reached on June 6.

column2: 2) [U] the process of starting a new organization or group 构成；组成
column3: e.g. Enormous cloud [[formations]] dominate the landscape on a hot, humid summer's day.；e.g. An agreement on the [[formation]] of a new government was reached on June 6.

column2: [C] (pl. oases) （沙漠中的）绿洲
[C] （海边或沙漠中的）沙丘
[C] a long narrow raised part of a surface, esp. a high edge along a mountain 山脊
[C] (AmE) （超级）高速公路
vi.spread out or cover a large area of land 延伸；绵延
column3: e.g. The beach [[stretches]] for more than two miles, backed by grassy dunes and sweet-smelling pine forest.

column2: push or throw sth. very hard so that it moves through the air very quickly 把···弹（射）出去
column3: e.g. A loose dog is at the risk of falling or being [[catapulted]] out of the truck bed.

column2: [U] a feeling of great respect and liking for sb. / sth. 崇敬；赞叹
column3: e.g. You might gaze at the Grand Canyon with [[awe]], marveling at its beauty and fearing its depth.

column2: 1) [C] an event or situation that makes you feel great sadness 令人悲伤的事；不幸
column3: e.g. We cannot cure the world of [[sorrows]], but we can choose to live in joy.；e.g. The president expressed his deep [[sorrow]] over the bombing deaths.

column2: 2) [U] a feeling of great sadness, usu. because sth. very bad has happened 悲伤；悲痛
column3: e.g. We cannot cure the world of [[sorrows]], but we can choose to live in joy.；e.g. The president expressed his deep [[sorrow]] over the bombing deaths.

column2: involving risk or danger, esp. to sb's health or safety 危险的；有害的
column3: e.g. The report calls for a ban on the import of [[hazardous]] waste.

column2: exposed, empty, or with no pleasant features 无遮掩的；荒凉的；索然无味的
column3: e.g. That's probably the most bare, [[bleak]], and inhospitable island I've ever seen.

column2: very impressive or powerful, and often frightening 令人敬畏的；可怕的
column3: e.g. They had to overcome [[formidable]] obstacles during their journey.

column2: 1) (of weather or living conditions) very difficult and unpleasant to live in 恶劣的；艰苦的；严峻的
column3: e.g. Penguins employ cooperative behaviors in order to deal with an incredibly [[harsh]] environment.；e.g. The solar cooker looks impressive, with mirrors designed to catch the [[harsh]] sunlight, focusing their power to create intense heat.

column2: 2) unpleasantly bright 刺眼的；耀眼的
column3: e.g. Penguins employ cooperative behaviors in order to deal with an incredibly [[harsh]] environment.；e.g. The solar cooker looks impressive, with mirrors designed to catch the [[harsh]] sunlight, focusing their power to create intense heat.

column2: [U] the state of suffering and death caused by having no food 饥饿；挨饿；饿死
column3: e.g. Millions of people in that region are threatened with [[starvation]] as a result of drought and poor harvests.

column2: [C, U]  a society that is well organized and developed, used esp. about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time 文明（社会）
column3: e.g. The ancient [[civilizations]] of Central and Latin America were founded upon corn.

column2: (fml.) happen before sth. or come before sb. / sth. in order 先于···（发生或出现）
column3: e.g. It would be helpful if you were to [[precede]] the report with an introduction.

column2: [U] the ability to continue doing sth. difficult or painful over a long period of time （忍）耐力
column3: e.g. Running a marathon is seen by many people as the ultimate test of human [[endurance]].

column1: trick sb. into sth. / doing sth.
column2: cause sb. to do sth. by means of a trick 用计诱使某人做某事
column3: e.g. Dean [[tricked]] the old lady into giving him 800 pounds, claiming that he would invest it for her.

column2: begin a journey by boat or ship 起航
column3: e.g. When Captain Cook [[set]] [[sail]] for the Pacific, he was heading to parts of the world that were little-known.

column1: during  throughout / over the course of sth.
column2: during sth. 在···期间
column3: e.g. We struck up a conversation, in the [[course]] of which it emerged that he was a sailing man.

column2: have to deal with a problem or difficult situation （不得不）处理问题，对付困境
column3: e.g. The rescue team also had bad weather conditions to [[contend]] with.

column2: [C] a pilot 飞机驾驶员；飞行员
column3: e.g. Amy Johnson was a pioneering [[aviator]] who made record-breaking flights to Australia and South Africa in the 1930s.

column2: [C] (pl. aircraft) a plane or other vehicle that can fly 飞机；航空器；飞行器
column3: e.g. Commercial airlines often find it cheaper to park their [[aircraft]] at a storage facility than at an airport.

column2: popular, esp. for a short period of time （尤指短期内）时髦的，流行的
column3: e.g. Reading has become the [[fashionable]] educational activity for summer months with schools and libraries running reading challenges.

column2: having no purpose or importance and therefore not worth doing or having 无目的的；无意义的；无价值的；不重要的
column3: e.g. He said a few [[meaningless]] words to his hostess and looked around the room.

column2: designed to be useful rather than beautiful or attractive 实用的
column3: e.g. Their tips provide guidance to anyone looking to set up a smart and [[functional]] workspace at home.

column2: 1) [usu. pl.] sth. such as a bag, belt, or jewelry that you wear or carry because it is attractive 装饰物，小配件（如手袋、皮带、珠宝等）
column3: e.g. This store offers a wide range of clothing, shoes, and [[accessories]] for men, women, and children.；e.g. [[Accessories]] such as a carrying case and a battery recharger are free with the purchase of a cell phone.

column2: 2) [usu. pl.] sth. such as a piece of equipment or a decoration that is not necessary, but that makes a machine, car, room, etc. more useful or more attractive 附件；配件；附属品
column3: e.g. This store offers a wide range of clothing, shoes, and [[accessories]] for men, women, and children.；e.g. [[Accessories]] such as a carrying case and a battery recharger are free with the purchase of a cell phone.

column2: [U] (fml.) clothes 衣服
column3: e.g. They specialize in the supply of sports [[apparel]] such as sweatshirts and baseball caps to retail markets.

column2: (fml.) not noticed 不受注意的；未被注意的
column3: e.g. There are many brave and admirable social workers doing [[unremarked]] work across the nation.

column2: (usu. passive) live in an area 居住于
column3: e.g. The world's largest iceberg would possibly crash into an island [[populated]] by penguins and seals.

column2: [U] the act of including sb. / sth. in a larger group or set, or the fact of being included in one 包含；包括
column3: e.g. Evidence is needed to prove that the word has been used in a variety of different sources before it can be considered for [[inclusion]] in one of the dictionaries.

column2: 1) very 十分
column3: e.g. She is planning to travel to [[distinctly]] different destinations in pursuit of happiness and vision.；e.g. I [[distinctly]] remember asking him not to tell her about the new sales figures.

column2: 2) clearly 清楚地；明显地
column3: e.g. She is planning to travel to [[distinctly]] different destinations in pursuit of happiness and vision.；e.g. I [[distinctly]] remember asking him not to tell her about the new sales figures.

column2: vt.make a complete list of all the things in a group 为···编目录；把···列入目录中
column3: e.g. The works came to light during the 1950s, when they were [[catalogued]] in the museum's collection.；e.g. She uses an online [[catalogue]] to search for items by price or country, instead of the hard copies traditionally taken to auctions (拍卖会).

column2: n.[C] a complete list of things that you can look at, buy, or use, for example in a library or at an art show 目录
column3: e.g. The works came to light during the 1950s, when they were [[catalogued]] in the museum's collection.；e.g. She uses an online [[catalogue]] to search for items by price or country, instead of the hard copies traditionally taken to auctions (拍卖会).

column2: choose and organize the art, music, objects, etc. for an exhibition, show, concert, etc. 策划组织（展览、表演、音乐会等）
column3: e.g. Focused on artwork inspired by nature, this exhibition is [[curated]] by four high school students.

column2: (fml.) (be ~ of sth.) completely lacking in sth. 毫无某物；完全没有某物
column3: e.g. Milly is the most serious person I know — her stories are always completely [[devoid]] of humor.

column2: relating to or having an effect on the emotions 情感的
column3: e.g. Studies in this area investigate how objects or messages can arouse [[affective]] reactions.

column2: carefully cut, print, or write words on sth., esp. on the surface of a stone or coin （尤指在石头或硬币表面）雕刻，印制，题写
column3: e.g. She signed the book and [[inscribed]] the words "with grateful thanks" on it.

column2: clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen or noticed 确凿的；明显的；实在的
column3: e.g. These fragments provide [[tangible]] evidence for how the city has changed since the 18th century.

column2: (fml.) combine and form one single group, substance, etc. 联合；合并
column3: e.g. His sporting and literary interests [[coalesced]] admirably in his writing about climbing.

column2: 1) [C, U] （用来做绳子、布等的）纤维
2) [U] （植物的）纤维，食物纤维
[C] a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth （缝纫中的）一针；缝
column3: e.g. You'd better put a [[stitch]] in the corner of the pocket to keep it in place.

column2: [U] the feeling people have that they are members of a group in society and that they share particular qualities with other members of that group 相互联系；社会关系
column3: e.g. Human beings have a need for both independence and [[connectedness]].

column2: extremely valuable or important 极其贵重的；极其重要的
column3: e.g. Her knowledge and experience would make her a [[priceless]] asset to the team.

column2: 1) the act of preventing sth. from being lost, wasted, damaged or destroyed 保存；保护；节约
column3: e.g. The project includes the [[conservation]] of 200 paintings, 15,000 books and quantities of furniture, ceramics and textiles.；e.g. China is one of the few places in the world where the elephant population is growing thanks to extensive [[conservation]] efforts.

column2: 2) the protection of natural things such as animals, plants, and forests to prevent them from being spoiled or destroyed （动植物、森林等的）保护
column3: e.g. The project includes the [[conservation]] of 200 paintings, 15,000 books and quantities of furniture, ceramics and textiles.；e.g. China is one of the few places in the world where the elephant population is growing thanks to extensive [[conservation]] efforts.

column2: record the addition of a new item to a library, museum, etc. 将（图书馆、博物馆等的新书、新展品）登记入册
column3: e.g. Objects will be accepted and [[accessioned]] into the museum's collections when these conditions are met.

column2: (fml.) (~ upon / on sb. ) necessary as part of sb's duty 有责任的；有义务的；必须履行的
column3: e.g. It is [[incumbent]] upon parents to control what their children watch on TV.

column2: 1) (fml.) sb. who guards or protects sth. 维护者；保卫者
column3: e.g. These oral historians were the [[guardians]] of traditional values and the teachers of lessons about the natural world.；e.g. The girl's parents or [[guardians]] must give their consent before she has the operation.

column2: 2) sb. who is legally responsible for looking after sb. else's child, esp. after the child's parents have died 监护人
column3: e.g. These oral historians were the [[guardians]] of traditional values and the teachers of lessons about the natural world.；e.g. The girl's parents or [[guardians]] must give their consent before she has the operation.

column2: 1) a book that you put photographs, stamps, etc. in （收存照片、邮票等的）簿，册
column3: e.g. We've put the best wedding photos into an [[album]] — do you want to see them?；e.g. The singer talked about the inspiration behind the creation of each track from his newly released [[album]].

column2: 2) a group of songs or pieces of music on a CD, tape, etc. （歌曲或音乐的）专辑
column3: e.g. We've put the best wedding photos into an [[album]] — do you want to see them?；e.g. The singer talked about the inspiration behind the creation of each track from his newly released [[album]].

column2: 1) in a way of happening or developing in a natural and continuous process 自然地；持续地
column3: e.g. The company has been growing [[organically]] over the past few years.；e.g. There is firm evidence that [[organically]] grown crops are healthier to eat than conventional ones.

column2: 2) in a way of growing food without using artificial chemicals 不使用化肥地；有机地；绿色地
column3: e.g. The company has been growing [[organically]] over the past few years.；e.g. There is firm evidence that [[organically]] grown crops are healthier to eat than conventional ones.

column2: spread over a wide area or over a long period of time 分散的；稀疏的
column3: e.g. The higher cost of providing full services to a [[scattered]] community cannot be ignored.

column2: [C] a piece of furniture with doors and shelves or drawers, used for storing or showing things （有拉门、搁板或抽屉的）储藏柜，陈列柜
(festivities) [pl.] things such as drinking, eating, or dancing that are done to celebrate a special occasion 庆祝活动；庆典
column3: e.g. This year's [[festivities]] included fireworks, light shows and a live concert at King International Stadium.

column2: [U] the quality of being unusually good, special or the only one of its kind 不同寻常；独特；独一无二
column3: e.g. It is the [[uniqueness]] of her painting style for which she has been remembered over the past decades.

column2: [C, U] a long thin string of cotton, silk, etc. used to sew or weave cloth （缝衣服的）线
[C, U] the act or process of repeating 重复
column3: e.g. Companies should focus on customer experiences and strive to improve those experiences through constant [[iteration]].

column2: with a clear aim or purpose, determinedly 有目的地；有决心地；果断地
column3: e.g. Upon hearing these words, she began walking slowly but [[purposefully]] toward the bridge.

column2: store or hide sth. 将某物存起来或藏起来
column3: e.g. Every member of the family can now [[tuck]] away either £9 or £18 a month in one of these savings plans.

column2: in the state of existing 存在
column3: e.g. That's why there are tens of thousands of start-ups in [[existence]] today.

column1: it is incumbent upon / on sb. to do sth.
column2: it is sb's duty or responsibility to do sth. 做某事是某人的职务（责任）
column3: e.g. It is [[incumbent]] upon all users of this equipment to familiarize themselves with the safety procedure.

column2: die — use this when you want to avoid saying the word "die" 去世；离世
column3: e.g. Stephen Hawking, who is known for his groundbreaking work with black holes and relativity, [[passed]] away at the age of 76.
